Extracted Data.Name: SURESH M
Extracted Data.Summary or Objective: Experienced professional with 7 years and 6 months of expertise, including 2 years as a Junior Planning Engineer and 5 years and 6 months as an MIS Analyst. Adept at data analysis, reporting automation, and business intelligence. Proficient in Advanced Excel with macros (VBA) for process automation, SQL for data extraction and transformation, and Power BI for creating dynamic dashboards. Experienced in using SAP for operational reporting and ensuring data accuracy across departments. Demonstrated ability to streamline reporting processes, uncover actionable insights, and support data driven business decisions across both planning and MIS functions.

Experience.Title: MIS Analyst
Experience.Description: Demonstrated strong analytical leadership by driving automation and data accuracy across nationwide reporting systems, leading to a 60% reduction in manual workload and significantly improving decision making speed through the deployment of Power BI dashboards and advanced Excel solutions. Automated 80% of manual reporting tasks using Excel Macros and VBA, significantly reducing turnaround time and minimizing errors. Optimized SQL queries and reporting workflows, leading to a 40% improvement in data retrieval and processing efficiency. Streamlined data validation and reconciliation processes, increasing accuracy across multi departmental reports by 95%. Led the migration of legacy Excel based reports to Power BI, enhancing reporting scalability and stakeholder engagement. Handled and maintained reporting for 15+ active client datasets, ensuring accuracy, confidentiality, and timely delivery of insights to stakeholders. Successfully managed daily, weekly, and monthly reports for operations and business performance using advanced Excel techniques. Continuously worked to improve and optimize reporting processes, reducing manual work and increasing productivity. Recognized for data accuracy and on time delivery, supporting 100% SLA compliance on reporting deliverables.

Experience.Title: MIS ANALYST
Experience.Description: Managing day to day inventory management. Analytics month data. Sharing reports on time. Manpower Co ordination, Monitoring S & G, Monitoring Pack size Follow ups, Inventory Reports, Shortfall reports, EOD Records, Tracker Maintenance all are done daily.

Experience.Title: Junior Planning Engineer
Experience.Description: Worked in the Materials Planning Department supporting project execution and inventory management using SAP ERP. Handled MBOM (Manufacturing Bill of Materials) verification and ensured accurate material planning for final production stages. Assisted in preparing planning schedules and aligning material availability with project timelines

Education: BBA in Business Administration Alagappa Univercity
Diploma in Electronics and Communication Engineering muthayammal polytechnic institute
Class XII govt Hr Sec School

Recommendations: **Reduce the resume length to one page** to ensure recruiters can quickly grasp key qualifications and experience, making it more effective for initial screenings.
Add **quantifiable achievements** within each role to showcase the impact made in previous positions, using metrics to demonstrate contributions and value.
Consider adding a **projects section** to highlight any independent projects or initiatives undertaken, demonstrating passion and practical application of skills outside of formal employment.
Include **relevant certifications** to showcase expertise in specific tools or methodologies, which enhances credibility and demonstrates commitment to professional development.
Reformat the education section to **list degrees in reverse chronological order**, starting with the most recent qualification to align with current resume best practices.
Expand on the **summary/objective statement** to more precisely target the desired role or industry, emphasizing key strengths and career goals to immediately capture the reader's attention.
Ensure all **contact information is clearly and prominently displayed** at the top of the resume, making it easy for recruiters to reach out for further discussion.

RESUME_TIPS: Quantify the impact of your reporting automation. For example, mention how your **Excel Macros** reduced reporting time by **X%** or improved accuracy by **Y%** across multi-departmental reports.

Highlight your experience with **demand forecasting** by detailing the forecasting techniques you used and their impact on inventory levels. Mention specific forecasting models or methodologies such as **ABC classification** or **EOQ**.

Expand on your experience with **inventory management** by discussing how you optimized inventory levels, reduced **stock outs**, or improved **inventory turnover** using **SAP** or other **ERP** systems.

Describe your experience with **omnichannel inventory management**, mentioning any experience managing inventory across both **retail** and **online** channels. Quantify the impact on **store fill rate**.

Showcase your analytical skills by providing specific examples of how you used data to identify **slow-moving** or **overstocked items**, and the actions you took to address these issues. Use **Tableau** to visualize this.
Quantify the impact of your **Power BI** dashboards on business performance, mentioning metrics such as **forecast accuracy** or **store performance**. Include visual examples, if possible.
Describe your experience with **merchandising analytics**, detailing how you collaborated with merchandising teams to adjust forecasts for new launches, **promotions**, and **regional preferences**.

Highlight your experience with **min max levels** and replenishment rules by describing how you defined and managed these rules for each store and **FOFO franchise**. Mention any software, like **NetSuite** or **Zoho** used.
Mention any experience with **supply chain optimization**, describing how you improved **stock movement**, optimized **stock allocation**, or reduced **aging stock** using data-driven insights.

Include examples of how you used **KPIs** to measure and improve inventory performance, such as **inventory turnover ratio**, **stock out %**, or **overstock %**. Link these to specific business outcomes.

min max levels.DESCRIPTION: Understand how to set min and max inventory levels for optimal stock management.

min max levels.DESCRIPTION: Guidance on determining optimal inventory levels through EOQ and safety stock analysis.

inventory turnover.DESCRIPTION: Learn how to analyze and improve inventory turnover using data-driven techniques.
Learn how to calculate and improve inventory turnover using different techniques.
Learn how to improve inventory turnover using different techniques.

sell through.DESCRIPTION: Understand how to analyze and improve sell through in a retail setting.

omnichannel inventory.DESCRIPTION: Develop and manage an effective omnichannel retail strategy.
